Title: üñº Z-channels accuse the command of the Russian Armed Forces of f...
Description: Z-channels accuse the command of the Russian Armed Forces of false reports about the situation in the Kursk directionOn February 6, 2025, Ukrainian troops carried out In the Kursk direction, the second attack in the last month in order to expand the bridgehead and move the front away from Sudzha. On the same day, the Russian Ministry of Defense reported that the Ukrainian Armed Forces launched eight waves attacks. -With the support of aviation and artillery, the Ukrainian assault units were stopped and defeated,- the report says. However, on February 7, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) and Z-channels reported that in days the Ukrainian Armed Forces advanced 5 kilometers southeast of Suji. Z-volunteer Roman Alekhin wrote a post in which he stated that the command of the Russian Armed Forces is hiding the truth and sending soldiers into battle without proper training, increasing losses: -It is the command of the Russian Armed Forces in the direction that is to blame for the fact that yesterday the enemy improved its position in the Kursk region. And it may very well be that today he will continue to improve his position, and the command, in order to hide another lie of recent months, will again begin to drive soldiers without training, increasing losses.-Alekhine especially harshly criticizes General Sukhrab Akhmedov, whose departure from the 20th Army, according to the author, became a real holiday for everyone. He notes that his mistakes, like the mistakes of other generals, continue to cost dearly on the battlefield.Previously, Z-channels accused General Akhmedov of giving away in June 2023 orderto line up Russian military personnel in the Kremennaya area, preparing them for action - as a result, the Ukrainian Armed Forces struck a military concentration with a HIMARS missile. The Marines of the 155th Brigade also mentioned Akhmedov in their complaint to the governor of Primorsky Krai, in which they expressed dissatisfaction with the command and huge losses near Pavlovka in Donetsk region.In December 2023, Putin signed a decree awarding Akhmedov the rank of lieutenant general.

Title: üñº A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has begun t...
Description: A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has come into effect in Russia On February 5, the regime for expulsion for foreigners illegally staying in the country came into force in Russia. They will be entered into the register of controlled persons, which involves a number of restrictions and prohibitions before subsequent deportation. The register is posted on the official website of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and is available in the public domain. A foreigner is considered to be notified of inclusion in the list from the moment the data is published. Persons included in the register will not be able to change their place of residence without permission from the Ministry of Internal Affairs, travel outside the region, drive vehicles, purchase property, register real estate in the cadastral register, open bank accounts and make financial transactions. In addition, such migrants are required to appear at the Ministry of Internal Affairs upon request. In the event of a double violation of the established restrictions, they are deported and placed in a special institution of the department. Also, from February 5, employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs received the right to independently expel foreign citizens from the country for violations provided for by the Code of Administrative Offences. These powers were given to the heads of territorial police bodies and their deputies, as well as the heads of departments for migration and drug control. The decision on deportation for violating the rules of stay can now be made by the heads of the transport police.

Title: üñº In January, Russian far-right groups carried out 118 attacks. ...
Description: Russian far-right groups carried out 118 attacks in January. In 91 cases, the motive was racism - NVMPNVMP project, which collects and archives video evidence of hate crimes published by Russian far-right in TG channels, recorded 85 videos with 118 attacks on people and property in January 2025. Including 16 videos of spray cans, 23 - with beatings, 8 with flare guns. In addition to people resembling Central Asia and the Caucasus, Roma property was attacked 4 times, people of Asian appearance 4 times, people looking South Asian twice, and an African once.B 7 In some cases, the attack was motivated by religious hatred: the attackers cut the wheels of cars with Islamic stickers and smashed the windows of halal food stalls. Also, 7 videos recorded attacks on people whom the far right called anti-fascists, including one child. In three cases, the attacks were carried out on people of Slavic appearance, who were called -pedophiles-. Based on the -cleansing of the nation- motive, two attacks were carried out: one on a drunken man, and the second on a homeless man. The motive for the 7 attacks remained unknown,- the publication said. The project notes that among professional groups, couriers most often became victims of attacks. Janitors, housing and communal services employees and sellers at kiosks were also attacked. Only four arrests are known.

Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.At the beginning of July 2023, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, no casualties were avoided. Title: üñº -The doctors said: it‚Äôs okay, he won‚Äôt die-: high school stude...
Description: -The doctors said: it‚Äôs okay, he won‚Äôt die-: high school student Yegor Balazeikin, convicted of setting fire to military registration and enlistment offices, was denied sick leave in the colony, despite his deteriorating condition and disability 18-year-old political prisoner Yegor Balazeikin continues to suffer from deteriorating health in the colony. On February 1, during a long visit with his parents, his body reacted strongly to regular food, which differed from the prison diet. According to activists, for three days after the meeting, Yegor could not get out of bed and was in such bad condition that he could barely stand on his feet. On February 3, the support group reported that Yegor was denied sick leave, despite his deteriorating health. He did not receive the necessary tests that should have been done in December, and problems with his spine reappeared. -Egor went to the doctor, but they refused to give him sick leave, they said that it was okay, that he wouldn‚Äôt die. They gave him some strange pills, and the antibiotic turned out to be not for him, but for another prisoner. For three days he ate practically nothing, drinking only tea. When I returned to the detachment, my condition did not improve. Since it was Saturday, and doctors don‚Äôt work on weekends, he was given activated charcoal and the drugs that I brought for the date. Yesterday, he said, it got even worse, he started vomiting, and his stomach hurt a lot. He went to see a doctor again, but there was no improvement, he was not given sick leave,- Tatyana, the political prisoner‚Äôs mother, told ASTRA. She added that she was worried, not understanding the exact reason for the deterioration of her son‚Äôs condition. -We brought medicine with us, but it is still unclear how to treat him. Maybe it was an intestinal infection or a virus, or maybe just indigestion from the fact that his body was not used to normal food after prison food. He never received the necessary tests, and I don‚Äôt know what to tell him for the next date,- she said, emphasizing that without tests it is impossible to determine the correct treatment. According to the latest reports from the support group, Yegor's condition is still improving. -Egor felt better. I started eating a little. The abdominal pain goes away, the vomiting has stopped,-‚Äî representatives of the group wrote in their Telegram channel.In November 2023, the court sentenced Balazeikin to six years in prison in the case of throwing a Molotov cocktail at the St. Petersburg military registration and enlistment office. Memorial recognized him as a political prisoner. During the trial, he admitted the fact of arson, but stated that he did not intend to intimidate people or cause damage. After reaching adulthood, Yegor was transferred to an adult colony, despite his health condition. In May 2024, he was included in the list of terrorists and extremists, and the Memorial Project recognized him as a political prisoner. Description: The Russian Ministry of Defense has prepared amendments that will simplify the conscription of soldiers with psychosis and syphilisThe Military Department has prepared changes to the -Regulations on military medical examination-, which, if adopted, will facilitate the conscription of soldiers suffering from certain diseases into the army. Judging by the documents, now, for example, conscripts with primary, secondary and latent syphilis are exempt from service under category -B- (limited fitness, not subject to conscription in peacetime). But if the amendments are adopted, guys with these diseases will receive category -B- (fit with minor restrictions). Description: Russian billionaire Suleiman Kerimov owned a stake in SpaceX even after US sanctions - BloombergMember of the Federation Council from Dagestan, billionaire Suleiman Kerimov, through a trust, owned at least 1% of the shares of SpaceX Elon Musk, despite the sanctions imposed against him by the United States of America. About this reportsthe American edition of Bloomberg with reference to its sources.According to the agency, Kerimov acquired a stake in SpaceX back in 2017, and the asset was managed by Heritage Trust, registered in the US state of Delaware. In 2018, the United States imposed sanctions against the Dagestani billionaire, accusing him of close ties with the Russian authorities and personally with Vladimir Putin. However, Kerimov continued to own part of Musk's private aerospace company until 2022. Only in the summer of 2022 the trust was blocked, but by that time, according to Bloomberg, there were no more SpaceX assets in it.How notes The Moscow Times, the share that Kerimov ultimately lost could have been worth about $3.5 billion - more than a third of the senator's current wealth. Forbes in 2024 estimated his capital at $9.3 billion.Sanctions against Kerimov were imposed not only by the United States, but also European Union. In 2022, after the start of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, American authorities expanded restrictions against the billionaire. In addition to blocking his assets, Kerimov was also banned from entering the United States, and financial institutions were instructed not to conduct any transactions with him.Suleiman Kerimov is one of the most influential Russian entrepreneurs. He represented Dagestan in the Federation Council for many years and owns significant assets in various sectors of the economy, including gold mining. He owned a key stake in Polyus, Russia's largest gold mining company.
